qas.question: How is the special sercice mode enabled?

answers.text: by a key switch either inside the elevator itself or on a centralized control panel in the lobby

qas.question: What is the impact on an elevator set to independant service mode?

answers.text: it will no longer respond to hall calls

qas.question: At what times is Independant service best utilized?

answers.text: when transporting large goods or moving groups of people between certain floors

qas.question: During independant service mode how is a single cab in a hall kept from being used?

context: Independent service is a special service mode found on most elevators. It is activated <a0_0>by a key switch either inside the elevator itself or on a centralized control panel in the lobby<a0_0/>. When an elevator is placed on independent service, <a1_0>it will no longer respond to hall calls<a1_0/>. (In a bank of elevators, traffic is rerouted to the other elevators, while in a single elevator, <a3_0>the hall buttons are disabled<a3_0/>). The elevator will remain parked on a floor with its doors open until a floor is selected and the door close button is held until the elevator starts to travel. Independent service is useful <a2_0>when transporting large goods or moving groups of people between certain floors<a2_0/>.
